ch.ethz.bhepp.ode

Interface FixedStepSolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdaptiveEulerSolver, AdaptiveRungeKutta4thOrderSolver, EulerSolver, FixedBoostOdeintSolver, ImplicitEulerSolver, RungeKutta4thOrderSolver

    public interface FixedStepSolver
    An Interface for solving an Ode with fixed step size.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void initialize(Ode ode)
      Initialize the solver.
      double integrateStep()
      Integrate the ODE with a single step.
      double integrateStep(double step)
      Integrate the ODE with a single step.
      double integrateStep(double t, double[] x, double[] xOut, double step)
      Integrate the ODE with a single step.
      double integrateStep(double t, double[] x, double t1, double[] xOut)
      Integrate the ODE with a single step.
      void prepareStep(double t0, double[] x0, double t1)
      Prepare a call to integrateStep().
      void setStepSize(double stepSize)
      Set step size of integration.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(Ode ode)
                throws Solver.InitializationException
        Initialize the solver.
        Parameters:
        ode - the ODE to solve
        Throws:
        Solver.InitializationException - if there was a problem during initialization

      • prepareStep

        void prepareStep(double t0,
               double[] x0,
               double t1)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Prepare a call to integrateStep().
        Parameters:
        t0 - defines the current timepoint for the integration
        x0 - defines the current state for the integration
        t1 - defines the end timepoint for the integration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if initialize(ch.ethz.bhepp.ode.Ode) has not been called before

      • integrateStep

        double integrateStep()
        Integrate the ODE with a single step. prepareStep(double, double[], double) has to be called before calling this method.
        Returns:
        the new timepoint after the integration step

      • integrateStep

        double integrateStep(double step)
        Integrate the ODE with a single step. prepareStep(double, double[], double) has to be called before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        step - the size of the integration step to take
        Returns:
        the new timepoint after the integration step

      • integrateStep

        double integrateStep(double t,
                   double[] x,
                   double t1,
                   double[] xOut)
        Integrate the ODE with a single step.
        Parameters:
        t - current timepoint for the integration
        x - array holding the current state for the integration
        t1 - defines the end timepoint for the integration
        xOut - array to store the new state after the integration step
        Returns:
        the new timepoint after the integration step

      • integrateStep

        double integrateStep(double t,
                   double[] x,
                   double[] xOut,
                   double step)
        Integrate the ODE with a single step.
        Parameters:
        t - current timepoint for the integration
        x - array holding the current state for the integration
        xOut - array to store the new state after the integration step
        step - the size of the integration step to take
        Returns:
        the new timepoint after the integration step

      • setStepSize

        void setStepSize(double stepSize)
                 throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Set step size of integration.
        Parameters:
        stepSize - new step size for integration
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if changing step size is not possible
